result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley J. Lakowske was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.
Defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

May apply for early discharge from probation.

Parties have the revocation packet.  No changes or corrections noted.  State recommended:  9-12 months jail.   Credit for 205 days.  Defense recommended: 6 months jail.  Credit for 205 days. records.addlTxt: State recommend for 3 years probation.   Defense asks for 2 years.   The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent. AODA.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Defendant elects to exercise his right to allocution.   Court orders sentence withheld, 3 years probation.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  AODA and recommendations.  Obtain and maintain employment as agent directs.  60 hours CS within 1st 6 months.  May apply for early discharge from probation.  CC.

ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared with Attorney Poss.   Defendant plead guilty to count 2.  Count 1 dismissed and read in.  Court reviews plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  He understands. Attorney Poss stipulates to a factual basis. Felony warnings given.   Court finds defendant's plea and waiver of constitutional rights is made freely, voluntarily and intelligently.  Factual basis found.  Find guilty of count 2.
